references.paper_title: Submodularity in machine learning and artificial intelligence
references.reason: This paper provides a broad overview of submodularity and its applications in machine learning, forming the foundational context for the current research.

references.paper_title: Deep submodular functions: Definitions and learning
references.reason: This paper introduces deep submodular functions (DSFs), which are directly extended by the novel deep submodular peripteral networks (DSPNs) proposed in the current work.
Deep Sets provide the theoretical foundation for permutation-invariant set functions, forming a key comparison point for the proposed DSPNs.

references.paper_title: An analysis of approximations for maximizing submodular set functions
references.reason: This seminal work establishes the theoretical foundations of submodular function maximization, directly relevant to the optimization strategies discussed in the paper.
This paper introduces efficient algorithms for submodular optimization, directly relevant to the optimization techniques employed in the current research.
